course: Professional Development Award (PDA) in Software Development
description: I developed skills in software analysis, design, implementation and testing - in addition to applying them in the final project and in many coursework projects.
I developed my knowledge of programming, algorithms, data types, data structures, modularity, and object oriented programming in Java, user centered design and testing techniques.
I applied the knowledge and skills I gained in many coursework projects.
Completed nine-month full-stack course for developing web applications.
I learned HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (ES6), React, Node, Express, SQLite, PostgreSQL, Bootstrap, Git, GitHub and Jest Testing Framework.

For my final project, I worked with a team of three developers, as well as a product owner and a scrum master, to develop a full stack web application to connect food banks with volunteer drivers to collect surplus food from local stores around Glasgow.
I developed more on my skills in problem solving, working effectively with others as demonstrated through the completion of many group works.

I successfully completed my  dissertation, with the title of: Nutritional status and associated factors among primary school adolescents of pastoral and agro-pastoral communities, Mieso Woreda, Somali Region, Ethiopia: A comparative cross-sectional study.

I gained collaboration and problem solving skills along with several social skills such as interacting and networking with new diverse background students, adapting to a new environment and involved in extracurricular activities.
